communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: department of education
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Under the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to and copies of all available emails, calendar entries, and other relevant records for the period covering January 20, 2017, to January 20, 2021, for the following individuals within the Department of Education. Please search records held within the Office of the Secretary, Office for Civil Rights, Federal Student Aid, and Office of Communications and Outreach, as well as any associated archives including electronic communication servers and backup storage.

1. Mckenzie Snow, Special Assistant, Office of the Secretary
2. Mitchell Zais, Deputy Secretary of Education, Office of the Secretary
3. Nathan Bailey, Chief of Staff, Office of the Secretary
4. Lee-Douglass Simmons, Deputy Chief of Staff for Operations, Office of the Secretary
5. Thomas Andrew Wilson, Director, White House Liaison, Office of the Secretary
6. Robert Scott Eitel, Senior Advisor, Office of the Secretary
7. Allen Ernst, Special Assistant, Office of the Secretary
8. Nathaniel Breeding, Special Assistant, Office of the Secretary
9. Sarah Delahunty, Special Assistant, Office of the Secretary
10. Jessica Newman, Special Assistant, Office of the Secretary
11. Cecilia Ines Martinez, Special Assistant, Office of the Secretary
12. Noah Mitchell, Confidential Assistant for Policy, Office of the Secretary
13. Kendyl Willox, Confidential Assistant, Office of the Secretary
14. Matthew Ide, Confidential Assistant, Office of the Secretary
15. Alexandra Pena, Confidential Assistant, Office of the Secretary
16. Jude Al-Hmoud, Confidential Assistant, Office of the Secretary
17. Rebekah Clark, Confidential Assistant, Office of the Secretary
18. James Rogers, Confidential Assistant, Office of the Secretary
19. Kara Neumann, Confidential Assistant, Office of the Secretary
20. Kenneth L Marcus, Assistant Secretary for Civil Rights, Office for Civil Rights
21. Mark Brown, Chief Operating Officer, Federal Student Aid
22. Marjorie Kilgannon, Director, Center for Faith and Opportunity Initiatives, Office of Communications and Outreach
23. Christopher Rinkus, Deputy Assistant Secretary for Evidence-Based Research, Office of Elementary and Secondary Education

The requested documents will be made available to the public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that any portions of the requested records are exempt from release, please provide all reasonably segregable non-exempt portions of the records. Please provide a detailed justification for any redaction made under claim of exemption.

Please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you for considering my request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Trevor Davis

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records related to the following matters involving the Iowa National Guard and its personnel.

Misuse of Iowa Department of Defense Resources for Retaliation:
Records involving the alleged misuse of Iowa Department of Defense (DOD) resources in a conspiracy involving Jackie Schmillen, JAG William Kelly, JAG Lucas Sterbick, Lt. Colonel Kristina Stanger, and Colonel Zach Nunn. These actions appear to constitute whistleblower retaliation and are connected to Regent Bruce Rastetter. This request also relates to my 2017 Iowa False Claims Act petition, which remains under seal, and my public letter to Polk County Attorney John Sarcone seeking civilian oversight of suspected misconduct. This misconduct includes the alleged misuse of MQ-9 Reaper drones for unreported "pay-to-slay" and "drink-and-drone" activities, which may not have been properly reported to the Polk County Medical Examiner.

October 2023 PPE Donation:
Records regarding Governor Kim Reynolds' purported donation of a warehouse of personal protective equipment (PPE) to "Israel" in October 2023. I am requesting clarification on whether the PPE was defective and subsequently disposed of in an Illinois landfill, or if it was actually shipped to Israel.

Disclosures by Intelligence Officer Zach Nunn:
Records related to intelligence officer Zach Nunn's disclosures to the U.S. Department of Defense (DOD) and Iowa DOD, particularly regarding potential inconsistencies in his 2018 testimony to the Iowa House. Specifically, I request documentation of whether Nunn failed to disclose his wife Kelly Nunn’s Foreign Agents Registration Act (FARA) income from China and Saudi Arabia via Brenna Bird’s LS2Group.

These records are necessary to investigate potential misuse of public resources, transparency concerns, and compliance with ethical and legal standards by Iowa National Guard personnel and related entities.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chad Brewbaker

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the primary briefing materials prepared in part or whole for purposes of the Presidential Transition Process, specifically any presentations created for, or delivered to, members of the Presidential Transition Team for the new administration.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

communications.subject: Iowa Open Records Law Request: Iowa Code 13.7 embezzlements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am submitting this request for records under the Iowa Open Records Law (Iowa Code Chapter 22). This request relates to concerns regarding potential misuse of public funds, unauthorized attorney fees, and violations of legal and ethical responsibilities in cases involving the State of Iowa. Specifically, I am requesting:

Unauthorized Private Attorney Fees under Iowa Code § 13.7
Records of all private attorney fees unauthorized under Iowa Code § 13.7 paid by Iowa Regents, their owned corporations, and institutions, as well as unaccounted payments under Iowa Code § 13.11 from State of Iowa settlement funds. This includes records from 2005, such as the $35,000 embezzled from the Iowa State University Foundation to Blouin for Governor via Belin McCormick attorneys Zumbach and Boykin.
Relevant law firms include, but are not limited to, Daigle Law (admitted in April 2024 in the ISU Daily), Dentons Davis Brown (ISU Daily), Belin McCormick (ISU Foundation, ISU Research Park), Husch Blackwell (2018 ISU Daily admission), Nyemaster (Krapf v. Rastetter). Additional information may exist under seal and should be included as appropriate.

FARA and LS2Group Incorporation by Belin McCormick
Records relating to the incorporation of LS2Group, a FARA-registered entity connected to Governor Counsel Bird. Specifically, I am requesting documentation of illegal funds funneled through Iowa Code §§ 13.7 and 13.11 to Belin McCormick Law Firm, which incorporated LS2Group using funds passed via ISU Veterinary Services Corporation.

Unauthorized Attorney Fees for Whistleblower Retaliation
Records of unauthorized private attorney fees paid by the City of Clive to Nyemaster and the City of Ankeny to Brick Gentry for matters relating to whistleblower retaliation following my May 15, 2024, whistleblower email to Senator Grassley. Note that your assistant Angela Studeman concealed this whistleblower email from the Iowa Ethics and Campaign Disclosure Board at their October 2024 meeting.

State of Iowa Trial Exhibits in State v. Brewbaker (Polk 2019)
Copies of all trial exhibits used in State v. Brewbaker (Polk 2019), which the Assistant Attorney General failed to file in the magistrate court EDMS system, obstructing my discretionary review and subsequent February 2020 PCR filing, which was never docketed in the district court due to wire fraud by the Polk County Clerk.

Medicaid Billing for 2020 Detainment
The total amount billed to Iowa Medicaid during 2020 for my Iowa Code 229 involuntary detainment, during which I was defrauded of 812 credits in connection with the aforementioned case.

Admission of Embezzlements in 2022 Campaign Statements
Documentation related to Attorney General Bird’s acknowledgment of embezzlements in her 2022 campaign, referred to as "Tom Miller's slush fund," including the $1.8 million kickback received from RAGA through structured $30,000 donations by Husch Blackwell and Husch Blackwell Strategies (as documented in their IRS Form 990 filings). This information should be included in an amended Iowa False Claims Act 2024 annual report for oversight by the Iowa Senate along with information of Iowa Code 229 missing invoices to county auditors.

Additional Context:
It appears that the Iowa Fifth Judicial District Court Administrator removed your office from EDMS access to State ex rel Brewbaker v. Thomas John Miller (Polk 2017). Additionally, the State Court Administrator is reportedly violating a federal settlement agreement to no longer conceal basic case information, which includes records involving the Iowa Attorney General’s Office.

This request aims to ensure compliance with Iowa Code and to enable proper oversight and accountability for public funds and legal processes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chad Brewbaker
